results.title: Power of the market
results.creator_credit: Graham Massey, Michael Latham and Eben Wilson and Rose Friedman
results.brief_description: First in a ten part series in which economist Milton Friedman expounds his views on various aspects of the market economy. In this film Friedman examines economic freedom as it operates in America and Hong Kong, and the individual freedom that results from it.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Graham Massey, Michael Latham and Eben Wilson and Rose Friedman

results.title: Rhinos and hippos
results.creator_credit: Mel Waskin, Bill Walker and Coronet Films
results.brief_description: Shows some of the similarities and differences between rhinoceroses and hippopotamuses in terms of physical characteristics and behaviour.

results.title: Pelicans
results.brief_description: Shows pelicans flying together in flocks, building their nests, hatching heir eggs and caring for heir young. Shows the attempts of the young to fly.

results.title: Zoo animals in the wild: ostriches
results.creator_credit: Mel Waskin, Bill Walker and Coronet Films
results.brief_description: The ostrich is the tallest and heaviest of all bird species, using its feet and sharp talons to protect itself against other animals. Shows the courting behaviour of the male and female ostrich as well as the care of the young. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mel Waskin, Bill Walker and Coronet Films

results.title: Monkeys
results.creator_credit: Mel Waskin, Bill Walker and Coronet Films
results.brief_description: Shows different species of monkeys and their characteristics, noting that while most monkeys live in hot climates, there are some that prefer snow. Also shows the lemur, a tree-dwelling primate which although similar to the monkey is not of the same species. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Zoo animals in the wild: lions and tigers
results.brief_description: Shows tigers and lions hunting, fighting and caring for their young, noting the playfulness and curiosity of the cubs. Points out that tigers are related to lions. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Elephants
results.creator_credit: Mel Waskin, Bill Walker and Coronet Films
results.brief_description: Shows the daily activities of elephants, such as eating leaves from trees, drinking and bathing in water. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Zoo animals in the wild: crocodiles
results.brief_description: Notes the physical characteristics of crocodiles such as strong jaws, tough skins and powerful tails; and shows the care of baby crocodiles by the mothers. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
results.description: Notes the physical characteristics of crocodiles such as strong jaws, tough skins and powerful tails; and shows the care of baby crocodiles by the mothers. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Zoo animals in the wild: beavers
results.creator_credit: Mel Waskin, Bill Walker and Coronet Films
results.brief_description: Notes the eating habits of the beaver and shows how it constructs a dam using its sharp front teeth to gnaw away branches, and its rudder-shaped tail and webbed back paws to gather mud to cement the branches together. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mel Waskin, Bill Walker and Coronet Films

results.title: Zoo animals in the wild: bears
results.creator_credit: Mel Waskin, Bill Walker and Coronet Films
results.brief_description: Points out some of the characteristics of bears such as their strength, their playfulness, and their curiosity as well as their inclination to be solitary animals. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
